item.title: Alysha add a quote by Elsa Schiaparelli
item.description: "A good cook is like a sorceress who dispenses happiness." -- Elsa Schiaparelli

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Robert E. Lee
item.description: "Never do a wrong thing to make a friend--or to keep one." -- Robert E. Lee

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Actress
item.description: "it is a sign of your own worth somtimes to be hated by the right people" -- Actress

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Here’s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Kim Addonizio
item.description:
"What Do Women Want?"
I want a red dress. I want it flimsy and cheap, I want it too tight, I want to wear it until someone tears it off me. I want it sleeveless and backless, this dress, so no one has to guess what's underneath. I want to walk down the street past Thrifty's and the hardware store with all those keys glittering in the window, past Mr. and Mrs. Wong selling day-old donuts in their café, past the Guerra brothers slinging pigs from the truck and onto the dolly, hoisting the slick snouts over their shoulders. I want to walk like I'm the only woman on earth and I can have my pick. I want that red dress bad. I want it to confirm your worst fears about me, to show you how little I care about you or anything except what I want. When I find it, I'll pull that garment from its hanger like I'm choosing a body to carry me into this world, through the birth-cries and the love-cries too, and I'll wear it like bones, like skin, it'll be the goddamned dress they bury me in." -- Kim Addonizio

item.title: Alysha add a quote by Karen Blixen
item.description: "I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea." -- Karen Blixen
